column5: Hi fellow OFCer's Heading up to Lowell lake lodge at the end of May for 4 days What lakes around the area have decent walleye fishing in them. We have a quad and a trailer with a 12' tinny so getting to a back lake shouldn't be a big deal. Thx

There are a few lakes in the area that have decent pickeral in them. If you carry on down Lowell Lake rd, you will come to the narrows at Cassells/ Rabbit lk. Good pickeral fishing in the narrows, in the evening.
If your feeling adventurous Try Desperation by ATV trail. There is a moose camp on it and its really isolated which is something I enjoy.

The small lakes in that area have been pressured for a long time now, but there's some still some good fishing to be had.  Use MNR fish online tool to find some of the stocked rainbow lakes in the area, awesome fun in the summer

The small lakes in that area have been pressured for a long time now, but there's some still some good fishing to be had. Use MNR fish online tool to find some of the stocked rainbow lakes in the area, awesome fun in the summer But how do you get into Pleasant
Thanks for pointing that out MS... missed that one in the past 10 years and so darn close, I know how I'm getting there this summer! lol
I'd have to look on a map...only went there once.  Within eyeshot of the firetower.

Lowell lake lodge is a pond with no fish. Spent last summer there and talked with hunters also - nothing. Hasn't been anything for years. Better off going to Temagami Shores - better acommodations, restaurant, friendlier young couple, right on big lake Temagami. You can walk into the village.
